title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 24 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: woman found dead after bungalows fire .
telford sign shrewsbury goalkeeper on loan .

documents.title: milton keynes dons 2-1 shrewsbury town
text: milton keynes dons 2-1 shrewsbury town

documents.title: 'world 's oldest ' mcdonald 's closes down
text: 'world 's oldest ' mcdonald 's closes down

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for live updates this week .
we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: your photos : beautiful bridgnorth
text: we 've shared quite a few photos of shropshire today , but we had to get these in too .
they 've been taken by a bbc member of staff in bridgnorth this afternoon .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: temporary homes found for bungalow fire victims
text: the housing association responsible for three bungalows damaged by a fire early this morning says it has found temporary accommodation for the tenants .
earlier this afternoon a woman 's body was found in one of the bungalows .
police say the cause does n't appear sus at this stage .

documents.title: watch : weekend weather forecast
text: cloud will thicken overnight bringing outbreaks of light rain and drizzle and a strengthening breeze .
as a result , it will be much milder and should stay frost free for all - lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be a largely cloudy , damp and windy day .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: much wenlock church could hold more surprises
text: when archaeologists found the remains of a pig and other animals buried beside the greek orthodox church in much wenlock , they were pleased with what they 'd uncovered .
but it now appears the site could have been much more significant .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: water main replaced ahead of schedule
text: a water main replacement in north shropshire has been completed ahead of schedule .
severn trent says moreton street in prees will fully reopen by tomorrow , nearly a week earlier than planned .
engineers have been replacing a 12in ( 30cm ) water main which had burst a number of times in recent years .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingpolice confirm woman died in bungalows fire
text: the police have now confirmed a woman 's body has been found in one of the bungalows which caught fire in bucknell this morning .
formal identification is yet to take place , but they say the body is believed to be that of the female owner of the house .
the coroner has been informed .

documents.title: dispute over academy plans for bishop 's castle primary school
text: a dispute has broken out over the future of bishop 's castle primary school , as a public meeting has been called to discuss the options .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: your photos : sunshine over shropshire countryside
text: yesterday 's stormy clouds and high winds are a thing of the past and we 've been treated to some beautiful blue skies over shropshire today .
here are two more of the photos shared by the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: ukip are blown away in stoke central
text: ukip are blown away in stoke central
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers look for big crowd against bees
text: telford tigers are hoping to draw over 1,000 fans for their home match against bracknell bees on saturday night .
they could clinch the league title tomorrow , if milton keynes lightning fail to win their match , and are guaranteed the trophy if they win both matches against the bees this weekend .
the last time the tigers got over 1,000 fans was the end-of-season playoffs last year .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your questions : is weston park in shropshire or staffordshire ?
text: sharon hartwell used 'your questions ' to ask : `` why is weston park always advertised as being in shropshire when it is actually in staffordshire ? ''
it 's quite the puzzle , weston park 's own website , according to its address , is in shropshire with a telford postcode .
its main phone number is also a telford area code .
looking on this shropshire council boundary map , it would seem weston park is half inside the boundary and half outside .
everything to the left of the blue line is within shropshire 's boundary .
so i guess in answer to your question , it is both .

documents.title: more arrests following shrewsbury drugs raid
text: police now say four people have been arrested after a drugs raid by armed police in shrewsbury .
two men from the town and another from liverpool , plus a woman , were detained on sus of intending to supply drugs .
armed officers closed castle gates during the raid last night , after which searches were carried out of the surrounding area .

documents.title: football : telford thank shrewsbury town for goalkeeping help
text: afc telford united and shrewsbury town do n't regularly trade players , so callum burton 's loan move down the m54 has come as a bit of a surprise .
and telford have made a point of publicly thanking their neighbours , after losing their goalkeeper matt urwin to injury .
telford also said they were `` really pleased to see the relationship between the two clubs growing well '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bungalows fire not thought to be sus
text: the fire which damaged three bungalows in bucknell early this morning is not believed to be sus the police say .
a woman remains unaccounted for after the fire and three people were treated for the effects of breathing in smoke .
police and the fire service have now started their investigation into the cause of the fire .

documents.title: glass sculpture at hospital damaged by storm doris
text: a glass sculpture outside the royal shrewsbury hospital has been damaged by yesterday 's storms .
it was one of two donated by sculptor tony roberts following treatment for a serious illness in 2013 .
it 's made up of two glass pillars engraved with words from conversations between patients and their loved ones .
the damage , outside a counselling centre for people diagnosed with cancer , was discovered this morning .
mr roberts says he will try to make a replacement .

documents.title: work to start on converting newport hotel into flats
text: newport 's landmark royal victoria hotel will be given a new lease of life after plans to convert it into flats got the green light .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: football : telford sign shrewsbury goalkeeper
text: afc telford united have gone to shrewsbury town to find a goalkeeper , after losing matt urwin to injury .
callum burton has joined them on loan and will play against salford .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager impressed by mk don 's stadium
text: the shrewsbury town manager , paul hurst , is looking to win away this weekend , against the side just above them in the league one table .
milton keynes dons have lost two and drawn two in their last five matches , while shrewsbury are rising out of relegation danger after three wins in february .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : more of the sun breaking through in shropshire
text: we 're seeing much better weather today and some great photos from the bbc weather watchers .
this one , taken near oswestry , really tells the story of the sun breaking through the black storm clouds of yesterday .
and this photo , taken on the hillside about ludlow , shows a much brighter sky .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: firefighters to start investigations after bucknell bungalow fire
text: firefighters and the police are about to start their investigations , to find out what caused a fire which damaged two bungalows in bucknell this morning .
shropshire fire and rescue service said blue flames were seen at one point , indicating gas was burning , and it later emerged there were gas cylinders stored in one of the properties .
the fire took around an hour to put out and one person is still thought to be missing .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: over 100 homes still without power
text: most of the power lines in shropshire have been repaired after yesterday 's high winds , but there are still over 100 homes without electricity .
across the west midlands , western power distribution says it still has to restore power to almost 3,000 properties .

documents.title: football : telford looking for a new goalkeeper
text: afc telford united are looking for another goalkeeper , because matt urwin could be out for several weeks with a groin injury .
the recent signing from fleetwood is due to have a scan today and telford are looking for a new keeper to come in on loan as cover .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : sunshine after the rain
text: blue skies appear to have replaced yesterday 's storms , all over shropshire .
and we 've been seeing some great photos from the bbc weather watchers this morning .
these ones were taken near church stretton ( top ) and hopton heath ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : report of lorry shedding its load at preston island
text: highways england is warning of possible delays around the preston island on the outskirts of shrewsbury .
there r reports of a hgv shedding its load on the # a5 at j8 # prestonisland nr # shrewsbury affecting both carriageways .
take care on approach
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: child sex advice website gets over 100 visits
text: a website which aims to help people who look at sexual images of children on the internet .
break their habit has been visited by 109 people from shropshire in the past 12 months .
the stop it now site was set up by the lucy faithful foundation , a charity which aims to prevent the sexual abuse of children .
another eight people from shropshire called a confidential helpline set up by the charity , to receive advice on how to change their behaviour .

documents.title: parents fail to overturn school catchment changes
text: parents and councillors opposed to changing telford & wrekin 's school catchment areas have failed to overturn the plan .
the council 's cabinet approved .
he changes last night , despite a strong presence from those opposed to the move .
many are from muxton , and want children there to keep using burton borough in newport instead of telford priory .
tory councillors say they 've been used as an `` administrative football '' , and that the plan will prioritise children from staffordshire .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : payne hoping for a start with the shrews tomorrow
text: stephan payne hopes he 's done enough to start up front for shrewsbury town at mk dons tomorrow .
the on-loan barnsley striker had to come off on his debut three weeks ago after injuring a foot , but is now fit and ready to go again .
it 's just one of those thing - it happens in football .
it ai n't always good is , so [ i 've ] just got get on with it and hopefully i get to show what i can do . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: community fund plan to save swimming pool
text: supporters of church stretton swimming pool say they 're looking at different options to keep the facility running .
no decision has been made on its future , but shropshire council has to save £ 77m by 2021 and needs volunteers to run services .
a petition signed by more than 1,200 people has been handed into the authority to try and safeguard its future .
sandra burgess , who 's a swimming coach in church stretton , says community funding is a possibility .

documents.title: council approves plan to raise council tax
text: telford & wrekin council 's cabinet has approved plans to raise council tax by 3.2 % in the next year .
the labour-run authority says it 's one of the lowest rises in the region .
yesterday , shropshire council voted in favour of raising the tax by just under 4 % .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: person 'unaccounted for ' in bungalows fire
text: fire has engulfed two bungalows at bucknell in south west shropshire .
one person is thought to be missing and two others have been treated by paramedics after breathing in smoke , the ambulance service say .
the alarm was raised at around 05:30 this morning , when emergency services were called to chestnut meadows .
one of the bungalows is said to have been completely engulfed , along with half of the neighbouring property .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police carry out drug arrests
text: armed police have carried out a raid in shrewsbury , arresting three people on sus of drugs offences .
west mercia police say firearms officers `` acting on intelligence '' raided a property on castle gates ( not far from the town 's railway station , at about 17:30 last night .
police say no-one was hurt and the wider public were n't at risk .
the road remained open during rush hour , but later in the evening a stretch from the station to the castle entrance was closed for several hours while the operation continued .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: three things you wanted to know
text: three things you wanted to know

documents.title: breakingtwo bungalows destroyed by fire
text: two bungalows have gone up in flames in bucknell , near ludlow - one has been completely gutted .
the fire service says `` at least one person is involved '' , but no further details have been given .
five fire crews from across south shropshire and neighbouring hereford were sent to the scene after the alarm was raised amid fears that people were inside the bungalows .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : 'nowhere near as windy as yesterday '
text: cold and bright to start with scattered showers and patchy frost and ice , especially on untreated surfaces .
most of us will have a fine and cold day with much lighter winds and some spells of sunshine - highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's shropshire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us or message via facebook .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : loan striker feeling settled at shrewsbury town
text: now stefan payne has recovered from his foot injury he is eager to get some goals for shrewsbury town .
the on-loan barnsley striker also says he is feeling very settled and that manager paul hurst is a big part of that .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers close in on league title
text: telford tigers could win the league this weekend , with home and away wins over bracknell bees .
they could even win it with one victory , if rivals milton keynes lightning slip up .
tigers are on a run of 10 successive wins , but the bees are on a good run of form and are making a late charge at the playoffs , so nothing can be taken for granted .
bracknell have turned it up recently and have had some good results .
they 're playing well and we have to take it one game at a time with these guys .
everyone realises that saturday is a big game , so we have to get the two points and then worry about sunday away in bracknell . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : rain tonight , but winds easing
text: we 're forecast some rain tonight , some of it heavy , but the wind should be easing .
lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rail disruption to continue this evening
text: rail passengers are being warned to expect more disruption this evening , as workmen battle to clear all the debris off the lines after storm doris .
network rail says its `` orange army of engineers '' have been clearing everything from trees to trampolines and chairs from the track , and bags from overhead power lines .
virgin trains and london midland have both urged customers not to travel if they can avoid it .

documents.title: football : deegan feels weight of responsibility
text: shrewsbury town added a number of youngsters during the january transfer window , and midfielder gary deegan says he and some of the other more experienced players are feeling a greater sense of responsibility as a result .
deegan joined shrewsbury in the summer and says the older players need to keep everyone together as they attempt to fight their way clear of the relegation zone .
and there is some good news for striker , tyler roberts , who should be fit for shrewsbury 's trip to mk dons on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: storm doris : shrewsbury town centre road closed because of falling roof tiles
text: raven meadows in shrewsbury town centre has now been completely closed , because of concerns about roof tiles falling off the charles darwin shopping centre .
four ridge tiles fell off earlier today , the centre said , and the road has been shut as a precaution .
the shopping centre is hoping to get workmen up to check the roof as soon as it is safe .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: patient found still conscious ahead of surgery
text: a patient at oswestry 's orthopaedic hospital was left paralysed , but still conscious ahead of surgery , a report has revealed .
it 's understood it happened last month and was spotted before surgery started , allowing the problem to be rectified in the anaesthetic room and for treatment to continue .
it was one of three serious incidents reported to a board meeting today - they also included an investigation into an incident when surgery was carried out on the wrong finger of another patient .

the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital says an investigation is underway and its director of nursing says the trust has a culture among staff of reporting all incidents , so they can be investigated and lessons learned .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: roof tiles falling off shrewsbury shopping centre
text: the police say roof tiles have been falling off the charles darwin shopping centre in shrewsbury .
and they are reporting that the short stay car park in raven meadows has had to be closed as a precaution .

documents.title: council agrees tax rise
text: shropshire councillors have agreed a council tax increase of 3.99 % from april .
members heard the council is facing `` unprecedented uncertainty '' in its future finances .
telford & wrekin 's cabinet meets tonight to approve a 3.2 % rise .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: red cross help ease prh bed blocking
text: the princess royal hospital in telford says the red cross is helping to ease bed blocking .
the charity supplies volunteer drivers who take ready to be discharged patients home , meaning beds can be made available for new ones .
they also make sure people are safe and settled back in their own surroundings .
we often have so many ambulances queueing - we need to keep the flow in the hospital and that 's where the red cross really comes in handy . ''
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : more road closures on a5 and a49
text: we 're continuing to get problems on our roads .
a van has overturned on the a5 near chirk and the road is closed between the gledrid roundabout and the halton roundabout , with traffic going through chirk instead .
and the a49 is closed at beeston and whitchurch , with long tailbacks being reported
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: dead horse dumped by roadside in cleobury north
text: a dead horse has been dumped by the roadside in cleobury north .
the female horse is thought to be around a year old and was found by a passer-by on saturday by the b4364 .
the rspca says the horse appeared to be in a bad state when she died , but the charity does n't know where she came from or who she belonged to .

it is very upsetting for passers-by and everyone involved when animal bodies are dumped so callously like this , as if they were rubbish , but for us what is even more concerning is finding out what caused their deaths . ''

documents.title: travel : a49 re-opens between shrewsbury and church stretton
text: the police say the tree has been cleared from the a49 between shrewsbury and church stretton and the road is re-opening .
traffic around the dobbies roundabout , to the south of shrewsbury , has been very slow because of the closure .
it 's also been having an impact on traffic around the meole brace retail park .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: london midland warns against any rail travel
text: the train operator has issued a blanket warning to people not to bother travelling at all because of the anticipated effects of storm doris .
# stormdoris we are strongly advising against travelling today .
tickets valid for travel today will be accepted for tomorrow .
@ twitterid any chance of the game being re-arranged for tomorrow ? ! ?
your ticket will be accepted tomorrow yes , before 12
indeed it does !
do you expect the situation be better later this afternoon ?
it 's meant to get worse so
by 7pm normal winds in london and northampton
it 's impossible to predict the weather , and i do n't think network rail will want to lift speed restrictions
totally appreciate that .
safety is most important .
trains are not just slow but not leaving at all from euston .
yeah , it 'd be unfair to hold lm accountable this time anyway
agreed .
just want to know if they hope to resume a more normal service late afternoon/evening .
i know the speed limit is in place till 1600 , so if the storm dies down , i presume the west coast mainline
preparing for a night 's stay at coventry train station then !
@ twitterid # stormdoris we are strongly advising against travelling today .

documents.title: storm doris : wall collapses as tree roots move
text: more damage from the high winds .
tan bank currently closed due to ongoing incident .
hi , please could you tell me if the road has reopened ?
thanks
do you mind if we republish your photo of the collapsed wall ?

documents.title: storm doris : trees down website
text: there 's a web page listing trees that have been blown over by the high winds on the shropshire council website .

documents.title: two hurt as tree topples across car
text: two hurt as tree topples across car

documents.title: pictures : car hit by falling tree on a49
text: these images have been released by west midlands ambulance service , showing the damage done to a car on the a49 this morning .
the red ford focus was hit by a falling tree near church stretton at 09:30 this morning .

documents.title: asylum seekers plea to council
text: the government has asked shropshire council to house more asylum seekers .
the conservative authority , which has welcomed 63 syrian refugees so far , initially refused , but a meeting this morning has been told another approach has been made .
the councillor responsible , mal price , said the authority may be involved in the future .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: storm doris : part of safari park closed
text: west midlands safari park tell me its adventure theme park and carnival section are closed because of the weather .
this means most of the park is open , but there is no access to the lions , wild dogs and tigers .
author: Joe Baldwin
News Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: storm doris : two elderly men in hospital after tree hits car
text: two men have been taken to hospital after a tree fell on their car on the a49 , just north of church stretton , this morning .

the ambulance service says the front seat passenger , a man in his 80 's , has been taken to the major trauma centre at the royal stoke university hospital suffering from a cut to his neck and chest pain .
his wife , who was in the back seat , was unhurt .
the driver of the red ford focus , who is 75 , was taken to hospital in shrewsbury with neck and chest pain .

documents.title: storm doris : over 4,000 homes without power
text: more than 4,000 homes are without power in shropshire because of damage caused by storm doris .
western power distribution says it is dealing with 42 incidents in the county at the moment .

documents.title: man arrested on sus of rape in pub car park
text: a 28-year-old man from bridgnorth has been arrested on sus of rape after an incident in a pub car park in the early hours of sunday morning .
the victim , a woman in her 50s , told police she was attacked at the back of the falcon pub in the town between 01:30 and 02:30 .

documents.title: storm doris : high winds causing disruption all over shropshire
text: fallen branches are closing a number of roads around the county and the fire service had to cut two people out of their car on the a49 , near church stretton , when a tree landed on them at 09:30 .
the wind has also been causing problems for bin collections and throwing around loose objects , like this trampoline in telford .

documents.title: storm doris : raf shawbury grounds helicopters
text: raf shawbury has decided to keep its helicopters on the ground today , until storm doris passes .
the helicopter flying school says all its aircraft are being kept in their hangars and it has recorded wind speeds of up to 63mph so far .

documents.title: midlands air ambulance grounded by storm doris
text: the midlands air ambulance has been grounded by the high winds , so take care while storm doris continues to take hold .
the charity that runs the helicopter says the aircrew will still be on shift , using rapid response vehicles to attend incidents .

documents.title: travel : trains between shrewsbury and wolverhampton affected by storm
text: debris on the railway line has prompted arriva trains wales and london midland to cancel services between shrewsbury and wolverhampton .
the operators are providing buses instead .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: no action over pool petition
text: a petition with 1,290 signatures which calls for church stretton swimming pool to be safeguarded has been seen by shropshire councillors , but they have voted to take no action .
the councillor responsible for leisure , stuart west , told the meeting the authority could no longer afford to pay for the pool 's upkeep by itself .
one of the councillors for the area , lee chapman , told the meeting he 'd be embarking on a 300-mile cycle trip to raise money for the pool .

documents.title: storm doris : fallen tree being cleared from a49
text: the emergency services are dealing with a tree which has fallen across the a49 between church stretton and shrewsbury .
they 're advising people to stay indoors if they can .

documents.title: swimming pool petition to be discussed
text: a petition calling for church stretton 's swimming pool to remain open to the public will be discussed by shropshire councillors today .
over 1,000 people have signed the petition .
the centre is expected to close under the authority 's sports and leisure facilities strategy , unless an outside organisation takes it on .

documents.title: storm doris : tree blocks a49 as storm blows through shropshire
text: the a49 between church stretton and shrewsbury has been closed by a fallen tree - winds of over 60mph have been bringing down branches all over the county .

documents.title: football : hurst says injured ogogo can still help town
text: abu ogogo could miss the remainder of shrewbsury town 's league one season with a knee injury , but his manager says he wo n't be forgotten .
ogogo has been a key player as paul hurst 's side have moved out of and away from the relegation zone .
he 's still got a smile on his face , he 's got a laugh that 's quite contagious and makes people smile and we want him to still be around . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tax rises set to be approved by councils
text: the cabinets of shropshire 's two councils both meet today to agree council tax increases for april .
shropshire council will put its rate up by nearly 4 % , while telford and wrekin council will increase theirs by 3.2 % .
council tax will go up each year for the next three years to help pay for care for elderly people .
telford and wrekin 's labour councillor in charge of finance , lee carter , admits residents are now faced with a `` sizeable bill '' .
the 3.2 % will mean roughly about £ 45 per year on the average property in telford and wrekin .
we set that out for three years - we thought it was only fair to set a council tax policy for a number of years so people knew where they stood . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: storm doris : flood alerts issued
text: flood alerts have been issued for the rivers severn and vyrnwy .
river levels are expected to peak near llanymynech this afternoon and in shrewsbury tomorrow afternoon .
the environment agency is not currently predicting flooding in ironbridge or bridgnorth .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : trains replaced by buses between machynlleth and shrewsbury
text: a replacement bus service is in operation between machynlleth and shrewsbury after a vehicle struck a bridge .
it 'll be in place until 09:15 .

services are also suspended between wolverhampton and birmingham international between 09:10 and 11:27 due to storm doris with 50mph speed restrictions imposed at a number of locations in wales , resulting in possible delays of up to 15 minutes .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: storm doris carries the threat of affecting power lines and some train services are cancelled
text: storm doris is on the way , with strong winds expected to hit parts of the west midlands .
gusts of up to 60mph are expected - with gusts of 70-80mph expected on higher ground .
transport is expected to be disrupted , with some train services between birmingham and wolverhampton cancelled this morning , including arriva trains wales services .
forecasters are warning doris could damage buildings and affect power lines .
author: Elizabeth Glinka
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: more than 50 motorists are driving on shropshire 's roads with 12 penalty points or more
text: fifty-eight motorists are still allowed to drive on shropshire 's roads , despite clocking up 12 penalty points or more on their licenses .
campaigners say 12 points should mean a mandatory ban .
figures from the dvla , reveal that one person in the county has 24 points , while another in west sussex has 62 .
the courts have the power to issue bans for a minimum of six months for motorists with 12 points , but that power is n't always enforced .
a ban can be avoided if a person can prove that receiving one would result in `` exceptional hardship '' .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : high winds on the way as storm doris moves in
text: severe gales will blow across the midlands today .
the worst of the rain will be first thing in the morning but gales will continue all day .
gusts of 60mph are likely in the cities and valleys , and 80mph on hills..
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email us , tweet us or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: mp urges women to make more use of rural maternity units
text: the ludlow mp , philip dunne , is urging women to make more use of rural maternity units like the ones in bridgnorth and ludlow .
after a meeting with nhs managers , mr dunne said `` increasing the number of births at each location is important to help secure their long term future '' .
the mp is asking mums who have had babies at the midwife-led units to share their happy experiences , to encourage other women to use the facilities .
he says births and antenatal appointments at ludlow have fallen over the past five years , but have risen in bridgnorth .

in order to be viable and to retain quality committed midwives , our midwife-led units need to have more babies born in our community hospitals each year , to improve upon the average of one or two per week . ''

documents.title: fatal crash man , 97 , 'cheery optimist '
text: fatal crash man , 97 , 'cheery optimist '

documents.title: tree appeal surpasses target
text: a fundraising appeal to replace fruit trees in market drayton which were damaged by vandals has raised over £ 200 .
about 10 trees in the community orchard were lost and local businessman , geoff sherry , set up the online appeal , saying the vandalism by `` mindless thugs '' had upset people living in the town .
the appeal has 24 days to run and has already surpassed its target , so mr sherry says any extra money raised will be given to market drayton town council to plant more trees .

documents.title: overnight weather forecast for the west midlands
text: a band of rain from the west will spread across the region this evening .
this will clear in the early hours when strong winds will develop , these strengthening close to gale force over hills by dawn - lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
tomorrow , severe gales will bring disruption in the morning , with a band of rain moving eastwards , though brightening though the afternoon .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : shrewsbury 's riley could be fit in two weeks
text: shrewsbury town say their full-back joe riley could be back in training in two weeks time .
he has been recovering from a hamstring injury .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : burst water pipe closes telford roundabout
text: the clock tower roundabout in telford has had to be closed because of a burst water main .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: your comments : 'world 's oldest ' mcdonald 's brings back memories
text: our short video tour of shrewsbury town centre 's mcdonald 's has now been seen over 86,000 times , by people all over the world .

the seem to be reviving some memories , with nia bailey leaving a message on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page to say `` it 's actually quite sad that it 's closing '' and lucie jones adding `` lots of memories ! !
very sad ''
jennifer braid wrote : `` it was the coolest mcdonald 's ever .
hope it becomes like an independent book shop or something ! ''
and linda kiff appears to be a fan of the way the building was adapted by mcdonald 's , writing : `` it 's beautifully designed to preserve the walls . ''

documents.title: your photos : flowers blooming in shropshire
text: has spring started to arrive in shropshire ? we 're noticing the bbc weather watchers are increasingly sharing photos of flowers blooming around the county .
these ones were taken in oswestry ( left ) and horsehay ( right ) , earlier today .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: next phase of railway station work to start at the end of march
text: the company carrying out the revamp of the severn valley railway 's bridgnorth station says it expects the groundwork and the reinforced concrete retaining walls to be finished off by the end of march .
iris projects says the walls will then be faced by bricks designed to replicate the original gwr buildings from the early 20th century .
the company says it plans to have a lot of these bricks on site and will be out the most appropriate , to make sure the new building blends in .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: warning to free runners after damage
text: free runners in shrewsbury to choose their routes carefully by police , after a rooftop in barker street was damaged .
the sport involves running across the tops of buildings and jumping between them , but the police have warned `` any reckless damage caused can be dealt with as a crime '' .

documents.title: your questions : what are job prospects and average wages in shropshire ?
text: a reader got in touch with us through the your questions section of the bbc website to ask : `` is shropshire a good county to live in and are there good job prospects ?
what is the average salary in shropshire and how does it compare to london ? ''
the last part of that question is the easiest to answer - the most recent data from the office for national statistics ( ons ) list the gross weekly pay for someone in london as £ 670.80 .
the gross weekly pay for someone in the shropshire council local authority area is £ 475.60 and for the telford and wrekin council area ( also part of the county of shropshire ) it is £ 482.30 .
the job prospects question can probably be answered by a look at the number of people not in work and claiming job seekers allowance .
the most recent figures from the ons are from january and report 1.3 % of the population of the uk fell into this category .
in the shropshire local authority area it was 0.6 % of the population and in telford 1 % of the population .
deciding whether it is a good county to live in is very subjective , although the ons has also attempted to provide a measure of this , suggesting shropshire is just about average .
other surveys have suggested towns like shrewsbury , ludlow and bridgnorth are among the best places to live in the uk .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: horse racing : step back wins feature race at ludlow
text: step back , ridden by jamie moore , has won the feature race at ludlow this afternoon .
the favourite , westend story , ridden by champion jockey richard johnson , failed to finish and the paul nicholls ' trained one more hero finished fourth .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: refurbished museum of iron to re-open
text: the museum of iron in coalbrookdale is due to re-open at easter , after a major refurbishment .
the ironbridge gorge museums trust , which is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year , says all three floors have been revamped .
the museum tells the history of iron production , from ancient time to the modern-day .

documents.title: watch : roadshow gives cancer advice
text: nhs staff have been out in shrewsbury town centre today , offering advice on how to spot the signs of cancer and catch it early .
chris ryder was one of the people manning their stand in the pride hill shopping centre .

documents.title: football : wolves midfielder says shrewsbury can 'do a bournemouth '
text: wolves midfielder , dave edwards , a life-long shrewsbury town fan , says the club can take inspiration from smaller sides like bournemouth and look to rise out of league one .
he said the club would probably need some time to consolidate itself in the division , before looking for promotion to the championship , but could probably hold its own at a higher level .
the welsh midfielder said if shrewsbury were to reach the championship , they would see `` full houses every week '' and that it would be a `` difficult place to come and play '' .
it 's not unheard of for a town of shrewsbury 's size to go right the way through the leagues .
you look at bournemouth and what they are achieving now , you 'd say that was a similar model to shrewsbury , four or five years ago . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: retaining walls being built at bridgnorth station
text: the expansion of the severn valley railway 's bridgnorth train station is starting to take shape , with workmen now starting to build the retaining walls .
all the pipework and ducts have been installed now and metal frames are being put together for the reinforced concrete .
the revamp of the station is being partly funded by a £ 2.5m share issue .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : newport face shawbury in cup semi-final
text: the second semi-final of the shropshire premier cup is played tonight .
newport town face shawbury united at ellesmere and the winners will play market drayton town in the final .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: daredevil 'free runners ' damage shrewsbury rooftop
text: damage caused to a roof in shrewsbury town centre was most likely caused by people indulging in the daredevil pursuit of `` free running '' , police said today .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: football : afc telford united not planning any more signings
text: afc telford united manager , rob smith , says he 's very happy with his strengthened squad and is n't planning on any more signings .
the bucks ' form and confidence has up , with a draw and a win against two of the leading national north sides in the past fortnight .
smith feels he does n't need to tinker .
there 's potentially a couple i could bring in , maybe , but at the moment i 'm happy with what i 've got .
the challenges have been laid down to us now , we 've got salford away a big game for us .
all in all the committment of those lads at the moment is just first class and that 's why we 're getting results . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: officer offers £ 25k to keep police dog when he retires
text: the sister of a former west mercia police dog handler says he has offered to pay £ 25,000 to keep his dog , ivy , now he has retired from the force .
sgt david evans was told his four-year-old dog was due to keep working beyond his retirement date as she was highly trained and it would be best to keep her in active service .
the money has been offered to cover the cost of training a new dog for the force .
i think they need a bit more time to understand dave as a person to see that bond between him and his dog .
24/7 david trains with his dog and looks after her at home as well . ''
more than 38,000 people have signed an online petition calling for him to be allowed to keep the dog permanently .
sgt evans , who 's 59 , has been told he will have to pass the animal - a malinois-cross german shepherd - on to another handler to continue working , say the family .

documents.title: shropshire 's most deadly roads : map highlights county 's crash hotspots
text: dozens of people have been killed or injured on shropshire 's most dangerous stretches of road over the last five years , new figures reveal .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: health roadshow to catch cancer early in shrewsbury
text: a health roadshow designed to help catch cancer as early as possible is in shropshire today .
public health england 's be clear on cancer roadshow is at the pride hill shopping centre in shrewsbury .
dr helen carter , from public health england , wants to spread the message that persistent `` tummy troubles '' like bloating and discomfort need checking .
our research tells us that people think that these symptoms are normal signs of ageing .
what we 're saying if you have these symptoms for three weeks or more , please go and see your gp .
for most people it wo n't be the sign of something serious , but if it is and it does turn out to be cancer , if we diagnose it earlier , you have a much better chance of survival . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : edwards would like to finish career with the shrews
text: wales international , dave edwards , says he 'd like to finish his football career with one last stint at shrewsbury town .

the 31-year-old still has a couple more years on his wolves contract , but says , if the circumstances were right once his time there comes to an end , he 'd love to return to the club where it all started for him in 2003 .
edwards remains a fan of shrewsbury town and still lives in shropshire and says that if he did go back , he would like to be able to contribute something .
i 'd never like to go back to shrewsbury not capable of producing enough performances to deserve to be there , so i 'd have to be in good enough form myself and not past it . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather warning in place for 'strong winds '
text: there 's an amber warning in place across the west midlands for strong winds associated with storm doris .
gusts of up to 50-60mph and up to 80mph on higher ground are expected between 06:00 and 18:00 tomorrow , the met office is warning .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your comments : the world 's 'oldest mcdonald's '
text: radio shropshire 's facebook page has a video tour around the mcdonald 's in shrewsbury , thought to be the oldest building in the world to house one of the restaurants .
it 's attracting a lot of comments - charlie davidson wrote : `` i remember going in to the little coves when i was younger pretending i was in some sort of cave . ''
mcdonald 's is due to close its outlet there at the end of the week and emily stokes wrote : `` hope it gets used for something where the building can be seen , not just as basement storage . ''
there have been comments from all over the world , with lenasue lc winston from california adding : `` i hope someone preserves those lovely windows . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: traffic delays expected in cressage due to work on pipes
text: six weeks of disruption is expected in cressage as severn trent pull up the old water pipes .
they 'll be explaining what they 're doing at a drop-in session in the village tonight .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: racing : horse tipped for a bright future runs at ludlow
text: the champion national hunt trainer , paul nicholls , runs a horse at ludlow today who looks like having a good future .
the six-year-old one more hero was a £ 100,000 purchase last may after some good early results in point-to-point .
first race at ludlow today is at 14:00 - .
the last is at 17:20 .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: red light cameras for telford 's problem trench lock interchange
text: red light cameras are to be installed at a busy interchange in telford , after statistics revealed nearly three-quarters of all accidents there were caused by drivers running the lights .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: hospital trust speeds up its recruitment process
text: the trust who run shropshire 's hospitals says it 's tackling staff shortages by speeding up its recruitment process .
following criticism over long waiting times , the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says it realised it had been taking more than three weeks to advertise vacancies .
now it claims to have simplified the process to little more than half an hour , helping to cut staff shortages .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new free school for 1,200 pupils planned
text: a telford secondary school is planning to open a free school for more than 1,200 pupils .
thomas telford school , one of the county 's highest performing schools , is putting together plans for a new free school for four to 18-year-olds in response to the town 's growing population .
they predict the town will need an extra 2,700 primary school places by 2025 .
the free school could be up and running in the autumn of next year or the year after .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your latest 50-second weather forecast
text: a cloudy day across the west midlands , with outbreaks of rain for many , though some drier interludes are likely too .
otherwise , breezy at first , especially in the south , though the winds will temporarily ease during the afternoon - highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all of your news , sport , weather and travel this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cameras to be installed on telford traffic lights
text: camera are going to be installed on traffic lights at the trench lock interchange , to catch people who drive through them when they are red .
the roads connect the a442 and a518 and and telford and wrekin council says over 36,000 motorists use it every day .
the lights were installed in 2006 and the authority said between march 2006 and july 2016 there have been 24 collisions there and 17 have been directly attributed to drivers running a red light .
motorists caught by the cameras will face a £ 100 fine and three penalty points .

documents.title: dog handler 'devastated ' by police decision
text: the sister of sgt david evans , the police dog handler who has been told he ca n't take his dog with him when he retires says he is `` devastated '' .
west mercia police announced its decision earlier today , after a meeting between sgt evans and the chief constable of west mercia police .
lisa evans said her brother had `` always formed a bond with his dogs '' and suggested it would have been kinder not to have given him a young dog , knowing his retirement was imminent .
she said she wanted `` further discussions and understanding '' from the force .
i think all pet-lovers out there , you know yourself the bonds that are formed , whether it 's a pet or a working dog .
so he 's always had a special bond with his dogs , that 's the sort of person he is . ''

documents.title: carrier bag owner in two minds about what to do with it
text: sue o'dowd is in two minds about what to do with her vintage tesco carrier bag , bought at a store in birmingham 36 years ago .
she said she was `` rather attached to it '' because she bought it in the year her daughter was born and tesco suggested she put the bag in a frame .
but mrs o'dowd , from much wenlock , revealed she had thought about donating it to a museum .
she also said it was in good condition with `` one tiny little hole in one corner '' and believes it has survived so well because it was used to store spare wool .
you get sometimes small museums where they show children what a shop used to look like and perhaps someone would like it . ''

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: cloudy sky and strong winds will mean a mild night with some rain and drizzle - lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
you can get a detailed forecast here , including warnings of strong winds moving in on thursday .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: 'oldest mcdonald 's ' to close this week
text: the mcdonald 's in shrewsbury town centre might look ordinary on the outside , but its medieval interior dates back to the 12th century .
it could be the oldest building in the world to house a mcdonald 's .
the restaurant is due to close on saturday and the fast food chain said the building `` was n't suitable to meet their future plans '' .
author: Johnty O'Donnell
Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bag for life : uk 's oldest carrier bag ?
text: how 's this for a `` bag for life '' - a woman still has a plastic bag she was given in 1981 .
sue o'dowd , from much wenlock , up the bag celebrating tesco 's 50th birthday at a store near five ways in birmingham .
describing it as better quality than modern bags , she said it was currently being used , 36 years later , to store wool .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : mosaic to brighten up shop front
text: two local businesswomen , who are frustrated at the state of cross street in oswestry , have done something to smarten it up a bit - they 've created a mosaic at the front of their shop .
catherine wilkes and katie millard involved local people in the design .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospital a & es have busiest day of the year
text: shropshire 's hospitals say they 've had their accident and emergency departments have had their busiest day of the year so far .
shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says its a & e departments saw nearly 370 people yesterday , but less than a third of those people needed to be admitted to hospital for further treatment .
the trust warned earlier this month that the two a & e departments are seriously understaffed and are being kept open by the `` goodwill '' of staff .

documents.title: watch : pleasure boat lifted out of river severn
text: it took over an hour to lift the sabrina pleasure boat out of the river severn in shrewsbury this morning .
the boat has to be taken out the water every two years for a check-up .
we speeded-up the film up a bit .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: public inquiry call over walk-in gp service closure
text: wellington town council has spoken out against a decision to close the walk-in gp service next to telford 's princess royal hospital and has called for a public inquiry to be held .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: your comments : police dog handler loses bid to keep his dog
text: the news that a west mercia dog handler has lost his bid to keep his police dog has got you talking on our facebook page .
hazel jump wrote : `` i understand both sides of the argument .
but i agree with the police .
that dog has gone through a lot of training .
to retire it before it 's done its service is a waste of funds .
but i 'm hoping that when they do retire the dog , that the original handler has the option of adopting it . ''

carol winter also had thoughts on the story : `` the dog has a job to do , and in the process of its job , it may save many lives , save many young people from trying their first drugs stop a terrorist or find a missing person the handler would have known this when he took the dog on '' .
but , she went on to say she hoped sergeant evans would be allowed to have contact with his dog after his retirement .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: underground reservoir work to close road
text: work to fill in an underground reservoir in broseley will mean closing dark lane in the town for up to a fortnight .
the road will be closed 24 hours a day from 6 march to allow shropshire council to bring in a drilling rig , which will be used to carry out investigation work before the infilling can begin .
diversions will be set up , taking traffic via church street , the b4373 and ironbridge road .

this is essential work to make safe a historic installation , but we do appreciate the inconvenience that will be caused to the community and will continue to liaise with the town council and primary school in order to minimise disruption . ''

documents.title: pupils pumped up at build-your-own bike
text: pupils pumped up at build-your-own bike

documents.title: extra patrols after car park rape
text: police investigating a rape in a bridgnorth pub car park at the weekend are putting on extra patrols around the town , to reassure people .
the attack is reported to have happened around the back of the falcon pub between 01:30 and 02:30 on sunday and the victim was in her 50s .
the police believe she did n't know her attacker and are hoping people in the area might have seen him .

documents.title: weather warning for wind
text: an amber `` be prepared '' warning for strong winds has been issued for thursday across the region .
it 's in association with storm doris .
the met office says heavy rain is also likely , with some snow possible over high ground and gusts of 70 to 80mph for a short time .
amber warning of wind for west midlands
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : thick grey cloud covering shropshire
text: we 've had plenty of thick grey cloud over shropshire today , and it was looking pretty gloomy over ludlow earlier .
this photo was taken by one of the bbc weather watchers .
but , as you can see from this weather watcher photo , things looked a little brighter around oswestry a few hours later .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: oswestry advertizer front page : morrisons site for sale
text: the site of morrisons supermarket in oswestry town centre is on the market .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: 'i love shifnal ' competition launched
text: people in shifnal are being asked to put pen to paper and say why they love the town .
signs saying `` i love shifnal '' have been springing up since valentine 's day and postcards are being handed out at the library for people to write down their thoughts .
the town council explained that the aim was to encourage a sense of pride in the community and people have until 8 april to hand their entries in .
there will be a small prize for the best ones .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: nfu sets out brexit goals
text: farmers need a clear plan following britain 's exit from the european union , according to the nfu .
the union has put forward its own plan which calls for access to the eu single market , with tariffs on other imports maintained to protect british farmers .
it also wants eu workers to be able to stay in the uk following brexit and fixed-term work permits to for staff used as during the summer months .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: policeman 's bid to retire with dog fails
text: policeman 's bid to retire with dog fails

documents.title: playing cupid for cows
text: cattle breeding is going high tech - dairy farmer kim petty , from richards castle , is bringing in pioneering equipment from new zealand to work out when a cow 's ready to mate .
he 's won the right to distribute the flashmate kit in the uk .
a device is glued on the cow near the base of its tail and will monitor if other cows have been `` riding '' , a sure sign the cow is in season .
it will then flash red for up to 26 hours giving the optimum time for artificial insemination .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: retiring policeman refused permission to keep dog
text: a retiring west mercia police dog handler has been refused permission to keep the dog he works with , despite a petition set up asking the force to reconsider .
sergeant david evans , 59 , has been told he will have to pass pd ivy - a malinois cross german shepherd - on to another handler to continue working .
west mercia police says it 's in the best interests of the dog and the force .

chief constable anthony bangham said sometimes dogs at the end of their working lives retired with their handlers , but there was an `` obligation to spend public funds wisely and ensure best value from all our resources '' .
although the dogs live with their handlers and have close relationships with them , they are not family pets .
they belong to the force and are highly valued resources .
pd ivy is very young and has many years service ahead of her . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: grenade found in loft
text: a royal logistics corps bomb disposal team was called to a home at halfway house this morning after a resident told police that a grenade had been found in a loft there .
west mercia police say the specialist team found nothing dangerous .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: oswestry mosaic to be unveiled
text: a display of giant , coloured birds and a floor-level mosaic will be unveiled today at baby bird cafe in oswestry .
cafe owner katie millard and catherine wilks from designs in mind want to contribute to the regeneration of cross street .
we worked jointly with designs in mind who are also based on cross street to secure some big lottery funding to basically brighten up cross street and make a bit of a statement . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: sabrina boat lifted out of the severn
text: a boat that tours the river severn around shrewsbury has had its biennial safety check .
the sabrina , which weighs around 30 tonnes , needed a crane more than eight times heavier to lift it out of the water .
sabrina boat
sabrina boat
# theflyingboat @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid twitter.com/i/web/status/8
# theflyingboat @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
# theflyingboat @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: kawczynski joins bid to oust speaker
text: shrewsbury 's mp is one of only a handful of politicians to back a motion of no confidence in the house of commons speaker .
john bercow has been criticised for making controversial comments about us president donald trump and brexit .
daniel kawczynski joins four other tories to have signed the motion after the speaker 's impartiality was called into question .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 800-year-old bell successfully taken down at myndtown church
text: one of the oldest bells in the country has now been taken down from a shropshire church for renovation .
the bell at myndtown church is thought to be over 800 years old .
it 's being repaired as part of a £ 200,000 pound project at the church .
the bell should be back at myndtown in may .
they 've got a beautiful sound to them , we want them back up there and we want people ( under supervision ) to be able to ring them so they can say they rang a 12th century bell . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: coroner 's court service seeks volunteers
text: a national charity is recruiting volunteers to work with the shropshire coroner 's court .
coroners court service or ccs train volunteers to provide emotional and practical support for family members and witnesses attending an inquest .
the service says it 's looking to expand its operation in shropshire and will soon be recruiting volunteers locally .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: town boss supports increase in 'intermittent ' drug testing
text: the shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says he 'd support drug testing of every football league player .
figures obtained by the bbc found that over half the players in league one did not face tests last season .
hurst says the punishments for failing tests should act as sufficient deterrent but testing is not regular .
it 's very intermittent i would suggest .
i 'm sure there must be some sort of schedule they work from but they 're certainly not in every day or every week . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police grants for groups working with young people
text: grants worth £ 600,000 are to be set aside for projects aiming to keep young people safe and away from crime in the west mercia area .
the funding from the police and crime commissioner john campion will be available for charities and organisations running schemes .
some of the funds will also be earmarked to help improve road safety awareness among young drivers .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : will you need your umbrella today ?
text: after a cloudy and mild start , cloud will thicken into the afternoon and things will become breezier , with some rain and highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom , bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for live updates today .
keep an eye on updates through the evening .
we will be back from 08:00 on tuesday with the usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather for shropshire .

documents.title: photos : officers want to reunite stolen bikes with owners
text: following a search in shrewsbury over the weekend a number of stolen bikes have been found by officers .
police have tweeted a series of photos of bikes they want to reunite with their owners .
here 's a small selection that have been released
for more photos visit @ twitterid on twitter or email officer , ingrid tozer .
do you recognise this bike ?
please contact ingrid.tozer @ westmercia.pnn.police.uk
@ twitterid may have serial no .
on record
thank you .
we are trying everything we can to get property back to owners .
@ twitterid
do you recognise this bike ?
ingrid.tozer @ westmercia.pnn.police.uk

documents.title: 50 firms are helping the jobless
text: businesses are being asked to find work placements for people out of a job in market drayton - although the local council has not yet committed to the project .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: campaigners try to save pool from closure
text: campaigners who are trying to save a shropshire swimming pool from closure will put their case for saving the centre to councillors later this week .
one of the members of stretton pool action group is due to address a full council meeting after presenting a thousand signature petition .
the council earmarked the centre in church stretton for closure due to it being `` small , costly to operate , requiring significant investment , and serving very small communities '' .

though the council has not stated how much it would save by closing the site , an official document says : `` in shrewsbury , there is potential to consider siting the town 's sport and leisure offer on one major site ; this would increase participation opportunities , reduce operational costs and provide real savings moving forward . ''

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: another mild night is in store across the region , with some rain and drizzle and lows of about 10c ( 50f ) .

documents.title: badminton england 'staggered ' by funding cut decision
text: badminton england says it 's been left `` staggered '' by uk sport 's appeal decision to withdraw funding ahead of the 2020 tokyo games .
badminton , which was set a target by uk sport of winning a medal in rio , is the only sport that earned a podium place in the summer to have its funding removed .
marcus ellis and chris langridge took bronze in the men 's doubles after the sport was given £ 5.74m in the last cycle .

jess pugh , from telford , is yet to say anything about the decision on her funding , but previously said her ambition of winning a medal in the 2020 olym would be made much much harder without any financial backing .
gb badminton are staggered by uk sport 's confirmation to reject the funding appeal .
we will now take some time to consider our next steps .
will it make any difference to anyone but th very elite ?
that 's the whole point of uk sport funding .
grass roots sport is funded by sport england .
funding is in place from sport england for grass roots badminton .
nothing for elite players !
and yet horseracing is to get £ 90million each year in public subsidy ?
@ twitterid
errr no it 's not .
err yes it is a state aid , paid by quango .
also the levy is given tax credits , or did you not know this ?
loved watching the guys medal at rio .
bonkers decision .
hope it 's overturned
stupid decision if there is n't medal potential they should boost funding not withdraw it !
this is so wrong how can they not see how a this sport deserves funding far more than cycling who have big sponsors
i 'm a bit behind ; only just read the news .
really bad decision , makes no sense to me .
not good
that 's very disappointing to here
fencing are crowdfunding - i 'll support this if you go for it
gods what a decision .
guess meritorious as understood by sport uk means your school has a velodrome or an equestrian centre
@ twitterid disgraceful
very poor decision .
i thought there was a lot of progress in the sport ?
crowdfunding i 'll sponsor
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bells lowered for renovation work
text: workmen are alert and poised and they start lowering down two 12th century church bells .
the bells , in a remote part of myndtown church , are believed to be third oldest in country .
you can see more on this story on tonight 's edition of midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Bob Hockenhull
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: crutch amnesty could save trust thousands of pounds
text: a `` crutch amnesty '' has been started by two hospitals in shropshire in a bid to recover thousands of pounds worth of equipment .

the trust which runs royal shrewsbury hospital and the princess royal hospital in telford say they are desperate for former patients to return unwanted crutches and walking frames which are no longer needed .
the trust which runs the two hospital says it issues around 100 crutches every month , with only a small number being returned , costing in excess of £ 10,000 each year .

documents.title: 'do n't eat meat from the bin ' warning
text: condemned meat has been `` stolen '' from a bin , but people are being warned not to eat it .
some out of date condemned meat has been stolen from a supermarket bin in church stretton .
if offered this meat , do not eat it .

documents.title: 'do n't go to las vegas - go to shrewsbury '
text: rod stewart 's tour promoter has promised a `` hot rocking performance '' from the scottish singer this summer as he takes to the stage at new meadow .
peter taylor says he 'll be performing all of his hits at the home of shrewsbury town in june .
it 's a huge set from his vegas show , so if you wanted to see him in vegas - do n't go because he 's bringing that show shrewsbury on 7 june .
that is the show you will see . ''
tickets go on sale on friday .

documents.title: new lease of life for waterside bungalow
text: the former warden 's home next to the mere , in ellesmere , has been given a new lease of life as a venue for functions and meetings .
it 's been refurbished by shropshire council as a venue for functions .
the property is in cremorne gardens and had been standing empty for years .
council workers who look after countryside sites in north shropshire will also be based in the building , but the authority hopes it 'll be a useful asset for local groups .
the refurbishment has given this well-known building a new lease of life and it really is a unique location for anyone planning an event
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 'flipping eck ' - pancake tossers needed to celebrate 50 years of history
text: world-class pancake tossers are being sought for a special event next week on shropshire 's iron bridge .
the event on shrove tuesday will be held on the world famous bridge as ironbridge gorge museums trust celebrates its 50th birthday .
fifty people are needed .
register and get involved via the trust 's website .
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: uk sport rejects funding cuts appeal
text: badminton is one of seven sports to have lost appeals against uk sport funding cuts for the tokyo 2020 olympic and paralympic cycle .

team gb 's archery team , which is based in lilleshall , shropshire , is among the sports to have its appeals rejected , as well as goalball , fencing , table tennis , weightlifting and wheelchair rugby .
earlier this month jess pugh , a badminton player from telford , hoped the appeal to the national lottery would keep her olympic dreams alive .
we want to medal and do the best we can .
we can improve so much and we 've shown we have the potential .
it 's confusing because we 're clearly on the right path and doing the right things .
hopefully we can continue go on whether have funding or not but funding makes a huge difference .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cannabis plants seized from telford house after man arrested
text: a quantity of cannabis plants were seized from a property in telford after officers arrested a man on sus of supplying drugs in the street then searched his home .
busy shift for brookside snt officers who arrest a male in burford for drugs supply offences and then find this at his address
sorry what time was the incident last night ?
4pm
can you give us a bell about this please asap .
has the male been charged ?
very important .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: 12th century bells removed for conservation
text: two ancient bells from a 12th century church in shropshire will be removed later today , for important conservation work .
the bells will be seen for the first time in centuries as they 're lifted down from the 800-year-old myndtown church , near bishops castle .

in 2015 , the grade ii listed church was considered to be in `` poor condition '' by historic england and was awarded more than £ 220,000 by the heritage lottery fund for extensive works to be carried out .
recently a new roof , repairs to stonework , re-rendering of interior and exterior walls has been carried out .
you can follow the story on the church 's facebook page .

documents.title: shropshire man jailed for beating 'good samaritan ' unconscious
text: a 26-year-old shropshire man has been jailed for a controlled and targeted '' assault which left his victim with serious eye and facial injuries .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: sir rod coming to shrewsbury is 'great for everyone '
text: shrewsbury town 's chief executive is delighted rod stewart has stadium for one of his two uk concerts .
brian caldwell says sir rod coming to the town is great for everyone .
we 're bringing people to the stadium who might not usually come and also the local economy .
do n't worry about the pitch - it will be in pristine condition for the forthcoming season . ''
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: the new saints knocked out of cup
text: the new saints are out of the irn-bru cup , losing 4-1 to st mirren in yesterday 's semi-final .
ryan brobbel had given tns the lead before half time .
but in a dramatic five-minute spell , tns had a man sent off and the home side took back the lead , before adding two further goals .

documents.title: town celebrates its lgbt history
text: the lesbian gay bisexual and transgender history festival took place in shrewsbury over the weekend .
many people from across the county came to learn about the history of the lgbt community through a series of lectures , presentations and talks .
one of the many stories to be told was one of forbidden love between two men during world war two
it was so touching .
one letter said 'whatever you do - destroy all of these letters ' because they knew that writing them and sharing their feelings was illegal .
but he did n't destroy them .
he kept them .
to have that little snapshot into the lives of two gay soldiers was very moving . ''
read and watch more on the history of the gay rights movements here .

documents.title: hot rod is back in town
text: `` i do n't want to talk about it '' but i will rod stewart is coming to shrewsbury this summer .
some may think he 's `` sexy '' and has `` hot legs '' , but well , i think he just `` wears it well '' .
the croaky voiced singer will swagger into the town with his `` handbag '' of hits , wearing his `` gladrags '' .
so `` sail away '' until friday - as that 's when his tickets go on sale .
`` tonight is the night '' - well 7 june is - as he 's `` got something to say to you '' - mainly just through the power of song though .
throughout march he 's going to be headlining at caesars palace in las vegas , before he starts a us tour in july and august , obviously after visiting shrewsbury .
sir rod : rod stewart will be playing the greenhous meadow on wednesday 7th june 2017 , details here >
ca n't wait for rod to visit the shire
@ twitterid
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: iconic movie of the 60s gets rare screening
text: on the 3 march , as part of borderlines film festival , there will be a rare opportunity to see antonioni 's blow-up , the italian film-maker 's seminal 1960s movie , at ludlow assembly rooms .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: bells restoration at 12th century church
text: bells restoration at 12th century church

documents.title: bells to be removed from 800-year-old church
text: restoration experts are to remove ancient bells from a 12th century church in shropshire for important conservation work to be carried out on them .
the bells will be seen for the first time in centuries as they are lifted down from the bellcote of the 800-year-old myndtown church near bishops castle .
the church recently received more than £ 200,000 from the heritage lottery fund to preserve the building , which is classed as being at risk .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: officers continue to investigate car park sex attack
text: investigations continue after a woman was sexually assaulted in a car park at the weekend .
the victim , in her 50s , was attacked in the car park of the falcon pub , off st john 's street in bridgnorth , at around 02:25 .
the force is appealing for information and witnesses are urged to come forward .

documents.title: telford rapist preyed on schoolgirls
text: a 21-year-old telford man has been jailed for raping a teenager while he was on bail for attempting to groom other schoolgirls for sex on the internet .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: rod stewart to play shrewsbury concert
text: sir rod stewart will be playing a concert at shrewsbury town 's stadium on 7 june .
it 's one of two warm-up gigs he 's performing before headlining the isle of wight festival on 11 june , the other being in durham .
he 's promising to play a selection of his hits , including maggie may , baby jane , i do n't want to talk about it , and do ya think i 'm sexy , along with some new songs .
tickets go on sale on friday .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a misty start there could be a few brighter intervals today , but also the risk of light rain or drizzle .
you can find a full forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from today 's shropshire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for shropshire on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
